alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Atlantic and east central Cumberland Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mizpah, or 8 miles east of Vineland, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Buena, Egg Harbor City, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Corbin City, Mays Landing, Elwood-Magnolia, English Creek, Dorothy, Mizpah, Pomona, Folsom and Collings Lakes. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 10 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
